Class BrickRotator

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.utils.BrickRotator
public class BrickRotator extends Object
Small utility that tracks the current rotation index for a Brick and provides the current and next rotation matrices.

This class is lightweight and intentionally does not mutate the underlying Brick implementation. It defensively validates indices and returns copies of matrices where helpful so callers cannot accidentally modify the brick's shape arrays.

  • Constructor Details

    • BrickRotator

      public BrickRotator()

  • Method Details

    • getNextShape

      public NextShapeInfo getNextShape()
      Returns the next shape (rotation) info without advancing the current index.
      Returns:
      a NextShapeInfo describing the matrix for the next rotation and the rotation index to apply.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no brick is set or the brick has no shapes

    • getCurrentShape

      public int[][] getCurrentShape()
      Return a defensive copy of the current shape matrix for the attached brick.
      Returns:
      a newly allocated 2D int array containing the current rotation matrix. Callers may safely mutate the returned array without affecting the brick.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no brick is set or the current index is invalid

    • setCurrentShape

      public void setCurrentShape(int currentShape)
      Set the current rotation index for the attached brick. The supplied index will be normalized into the valid range [0, numberOfShapes-1].
      Parameters:
      currentShape - desired rotation index (may be negative or larger than the number of shapes; it will be normalized).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no brick is set

    • setBrick

      public void setBrick(Brick brick)
      Attach a new Brick instance to this rotator and reset the rotation index to 0.
      Parameters:
      brick - the brick to attach; must be non-null

    • getBrick

      public Brick getBrick()
      Return the currently attached brick, or null when none is set.
      Returns:
      the attached Brick or null.
